reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Of the three Austrian hotels, this was the family favorite. Old world charm. The staff is superb! They could not have been more helpful and make you feel as if you are their only guest. The ariconditioning functioned well enough for my very picky husband duing a very hot spell in Vienna. If you prefer big hotel chain accomodations, then this is not the place for you. But we absolutely loved it and think fondly of it as our flat in Vienna.
reviews.title: Our favorite Austrian Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are a family of 5 with three teenage boys. This was our 2nd stop of a 21 day trip throughout Eastern Europe. We rented 2 rooms at this hotel. The hotel was pleasant, and the rooms were large. One room had carpeting, but the other did not. Thankfully, we were on a non-smoking floor. The staff couldn't have been any nicer or more helpful. They were eager to please and to make our 4-night stay wonderful. The breakfast was lovely although the breakfast room is in the basement. That said, the room was bright and cheery. The room was spacious but bare-bones. Nothing was of high quality and I must say that the towels were extremely thin and very rough. The bedding was comfortable but the linens have seen better days. There is one elevator in the hotel and it is rather small. The location was definitely off the beaten path. We quickly learned the subway system and took it everywhere. There is a subway station 1/2 block from the hotel which made it extremely convenient to travel via the subway. I would probably stay here again, given that the hospitality of the staff was so outstanding.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed over the Easter break with the main aim of visiting lots of museums. We were both very pleased with the the room which was clean and of good decoration (though the air conditioning wasn't effective). There was an excellent breakfast buffet that offered a good variety of food, both Austrian and English. We would definitely go to the Johann Strauss again when visiting Vienna.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable and a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We find excellent traditional hospitality in this bed-and-breakfast hotel on the fringes of the Embassy District, near Karlskirche, the Belvedere art gallery and the Technical University. The city centre is fifteen minutes' walk away, or five minutes by subway. The friendly check-in clerk offers further help with recommendations for restaurants and entertainments.
reviews.title: Restful stay and fine Viennese hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plentiful staff keep the whole hotel spotlessly clean, with shining mirrors and glasses. Even Swiss guests must be impressed.
reviews.title: Helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here for five nights earlier this month, and my experience accords with those of most other reviewers. The Johann Strauss is a smallish hotel (about 60 rooms) very well located on a relatively quiet street near the Technical University, about 1km south of the Stephansdom. It is practically on top of a U-Bahn station, and the trams run along a parallel street about a hundred metres away, so connections are excellent. A typical continental breakfast with a good range of quality produce (including smoked salmon and sparkling wine) is served in a well-decorated basement room. There is a small bar, but no evening restaurant service. That last is no loss, as Vienna is in no way short of restaurants!
reviews.title: Good hotel in traditional style, exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room I was allocated was pleasant and spotlessly clean. Free WiFi and safe facilities were provided, along with a pay-for minibar. I found the bed a little hard (but that is true of many hotel beds) and wasn't able to get the air conditioning to keep me as cool as I like, so I didn't sleep particularly well.
reviews.title: We didn't choose to stay here - but they went out of their way to be helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: All of the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. My every request was met with "certainly" and a prompt response. Whenever I got to the limit of my German (all too quickly, I fear), every member of staff readily switched without comment to fluent English.
reviews.title: Good location, awesome breakfast, small room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were very rudely shunted out of Hotel Erzherzog Rainer after the hotel supposedly double booked our rooms - and we were taken to this hotel Johann Strauss. The management here did a very fine job of looking after us as we were very grumpy and unhappy at being so summarily dumped by Erzherzog Rainer!
reviews.title: conference visit plus some spare time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel to be a 2 minute walk to an underground station, as well as having a selection of restaurants and a supermarket nearby. The breakfast was average - one morning they ran out of tea bags, they only ever had 1 or 2 croissants - but breakfast isn't everything. The staff were all amazing - we would spend a bit of time in the bar area - they have a fantastic aquarium you can watch while having drink - and the waiters were great.
reviews.title: convenient location but needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 days early november. We liked the hotel very much because of the following reasons:
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - perfect location. Really close to subway and tram, opera and city center on walking distance.
reviews.title: Mixed...

likes.liked: — The breakfast and the friendly staff at breakfast...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - clean room, pleasant smell
reviews.title: wonderfull hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: - hospitable, friendly staff
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - first class breakfast, including austrian champagne.
reviews.title: great experince

likes.disliked: — the maintanance crew was quite loud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I needed a place to stay for two weeks after a previous holiday plan fell by the wayside.
reviews.title: A bit 'meh'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Whilst the location was excellent; literally a minutes walk to the U-Bahn station. I found the hotel to be a little disappointing. The free Wi-Fi barely worked, and regularly lost connectivity and I was literally upstairs from the reception.
reviews.title: Excellent Value in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was also quite poor, with very little in terms of selection. The eggs and bacon were usually always cold too.
reviews.title: A lucky find in Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms weren't awful, but the bed certainly was. The pillows were about as thick as the pillow case cover and the bed was quite lumpy.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One excellent positive however is the courteous staff working there. Especially the very attractive blonde behind the reception that had a smile to die for!
reviews.title: Quirky place; good in parts
